refnamediv.refpurpose:
attribute_rename
attributes
renaming Produces a result array with the same dimensions, attributes, and cell values as a source array, but with one or more of the attributes renamed.

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The attribute_rename operator produces a result array that is nearly identical to a source array, except that one or more attributes are renamed.
To persist the new attribute names when you use attribute_rename, you must store the results to a new arrayâ€”if you store to the original array, the original attribute names are left in place.
You can achieve the same functionality (and more) by using the cast operator. For details, see .
You can use the attribute_rename operator in the FROM clause of an AQL SELECT statement, as a stand-alone operator in a AFL statement, or as an operand within other SciDB operators.

informalexample.para: This example takes an array, and renames one attribute and excludes one attribute from the results.

step.para: Show the source_array:--afl create array event <event:string>[i=0:12,12,0]; --show-query=no --show-output=no --afl store(build(event, '[("dash"),("dash"),("steeplechase"),("marathon"),("marathon"),("marathon")]', true),event); --show-query=no --show-output=no --afl create array year <year:int64>[i=0:12,12,0]; --show-query=no --show-output=no --afl store(build(year, '[1996,2000,2000,1996,2000,2008]',true),year); --show-query=no --show-output=no --afl create array person <person:string>[i=0:12,12,0]; --show-query=no --show-output=no --afl store(build(person, '[("Bailey"),("Greene"),("Kosgei"),("Thugwane"),("Abera"),("Wanjiru")]', true),person); --show-query=no --show-output=no --afl create array country <country:string>[i=0:12,12,0]; --show-query=no --show-output=no --afl store(build(country, '[("Canada"),("USA"),("Kenya"),("Kenya"),("Ethiopia"),("Kenya")]', true),country); --show-query=no --show-output=no --afl create array time <time:double>[i=0:12,12,0]; --show-query=no --show-output=no --afl store(build(time, '[9.84,9.87,503.17,7956,7811,7596]', true),time); --show-query=no --show-output=no --afl store(join(year, join(event, join(person, join(country,time)))),winnersFlat); --show-query=no --output-format=dcsv

Use the project operator to exclude the person attribute, and the attribute_rename operator to rename the time attribute:--afl store(attribute_rename(project(winnersFlat,year, event, country, time), time,time_in_seconds),result); --output-format=dcsv
